A president’s power over student debt stems in part from most student loans being held directly by the federal government. Following the financial crisis, the federal government
bailed out the student loan industry
and began to originate loans itself rather than relying on private lenders.

Biden’s ability to pass most legislation hinges on Democratic control of the Senate, which would require winning both runoff elections in Georgia. Even if Democrats win control of the Senate, key Democratic votes like Senator Joe Manchin have signaled reluctance to getting rid of the filibuster, which would allow Republicans to block virtually any progressive legislation.
Biden’s Mixed Record On Debt Relief
For some researchers and policy advocates, Biden’s campaign proposal to limit cancellation to undergraduate public school tuition does not go far enough and disadvantages Black borrowers.

“A large chunk of Black borrowers’ debt is from grad school,” explained Louise Seamster, a Professor of Sociology at the University of Iowa whose research helped inform Warren’s debt forgiveness plan. “Due to discrimination, they often have to get a grad degree to have their education read as equivalent to a white BA. We need relief for borrowers at for-profits for the same reasons.”

Canceling student debt could be “a stimulus for the economy” that would have “immediate and long term effects,” Seamster continued. “We’re running out of runway on the status quo. Even the mortgage industry has started complaining that student debt is eating into their profits. People can’t buy houses at the age when they usually buy houses.”

Progressive groups are already gearing up to fight for debt cancellation once Biden is in office.  “President-elect Biden and Vice President-elect (Kamala) Harris will not need to wait for congressional action to make a difference for millions of former students and their families,” Eileen Connor, the Legal Director at the Project on Predatory Student Lending, said in a statement. “They have the power and legal authority to order their Department of Education to cancel millions in student debts on day one of their administration.”

But actually canceling student debt would be a major shift for Biden, who spent much of his career in the Senate making it harder for student borrowers to reduce their debt in bankruptcy. In 1978, Biden

that required students to wait five years after graduation before they could file bankruptcy on their student loans. And in 2005, Biden helped pass a landmark bankruptcy reform bill that made it virtually impossible for any student borrower to discharge their student debt in bankruptcy.
“This is one of the problems where the longer you let it go the worse it gets," said Seamster.
